member.name: IKsJackDescription.GetJackCount
member.summary: The GetJackCount method gets the number of jacks required to connect to an audio endpoint device.
member.param: Pointer to a UINT variable into which the method writes the number of jacks associated with the connector.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, possible return codes include, but are not limited to, the values shown in the following table.

member.name: IKsJackDescription.GetJackDescription
member.summary: The GetJackDescription method gets a description of an audio jack.
member.param: The jack index. If the connection consists of n jacks, the jacks are numbered from 0 to n– 1. To get the number of jacks, call the method.
Pointer to a caller-allocated buffer into which the method writes a structure of type that contains information about the jack. The buffer size must be at least sizeof(KSJACK_DESCRIPTION).

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, possible return codes include, but are not limited to, the values shown in the following table.

listheader.description: Parameter nJack is not a valid jack index.

summary.para: The IKsJackDescription interface provides information about the jacks or internal connectors that provide a physical connection between a device on an audio adapter and an external or internal endpoint device (for example, a microphone or CD player). The client obtains a reference to the IKsJackDescription interface of a part by calling the method with parameter refiid set to REFIID IID_IKsJackDescription. The call to IPart.Activate succeeds only if the part supports the IKsJackDescription interface. Only a part object that represents a connector with a Physical_External or Physical_Internal connection type will support this interface.

Most Windows audio adapter drivers support the Windows Driver Model (WDM) and use kernel-streaming (KS) properties to represent the hardware description parameters in connectors (referred to as KS pins). The IKsJackDescription interface provides convenient access to the KSPROPERTY_JACK_DESCRIPTION property of a connector to an endpoint device. For more information about KS properties and KS pins, see the Windows DDK documentation.
